findings.title: Arithmetic Rounding Abuse
findings.description: The finding investigates whether arithmetic rounding can be exploited to drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Are the front-running risks well understood?
findings.description: The assessment checked if the contract is vulnerable to front-running attacks.

findings.title: Vyper Language-Specific Issues
findings.description: Presence of Vyper language-specific issues in the smart contract

findings.title: Can the pool's creator access unexpected privileges?
findings.description: The finding checks if the pool's creator has unauthorized access to certain features or functionalities.

findings.title: Can the pool be trapped due to gas limitations?
findings.description: The finding checks if the pool can be trapped due to gas limitations, which could lead to unexpected behavior or vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Are the interactions with the external tokens properly done?
findings.description: Verify if functions working with underlying tokens behave similarly to original functions

findings.title: Is the contract free of re-entrancies?
findings.description: Checking if the contract has any re-entrancy vulnerabilities

findings.title: Inconsistent Token Handling
findings.description: The functions may not work with underlying tokens as intended, differing from original functionality.

findings.title: Can a user pay a greater price than expected?
findings.description: Due to time constraints, some areas were only partly covered, including the impact of arithmetic rounding over multiple transactions; our preliminary results showed a negligible impact.
